Docs.summary: Makes the associated input control a required field.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this control to make an input control a required field. The input control fails validation if its value does not change from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RequiredFieldValidator.InitialValue%2A> property upon losing focus.
Multiple validators can be associated with the same input control. For example, a RequiredFieldValidator can be used to ensure input to a control, while at the same time a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.RangeValidator> can be used to ensure that the input is within a specified data range.
> [!NOTE] > When you use the RequiredFieldValidator control inside an <xref:System.Web.UI.UpdatePanel> control, make sure that the validator control and the control it is associated with are in the same panel. For more information about using the <xref:System.Web.UI.UpdatePanel> control for partial-page updates, see [Partial-Page Rendering Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
For additional information on validation controls, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseValidator>.
## Accessibility For information about how to configure this control so that it generates markup that conforms to accessibility standards, see [Accessibility in Visual Studio and ASP.NET](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) and [ASP.NET Controls and Accessibility](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the initial value of the associated input control.
Docs.value: A string that specifies the initial value of the associated input control. The default is <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to specify the initial value of the input control.
Validation fails only if the value of the associated input control matches this InitialValue upon losing focus.
> [!NOTE] > The strings in both the InitialValue property and the input control are trimmed to remove extra spaces before and after the string before validation is performed.
This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes. For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> and [ASP.NET Themes and Skins](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
